body:
On Wed, Sep 2, 2015 at 7:13 PM, David Crawshaw <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>
>> This was discussed on the list beforehand, but indeed, this proposal declares that one repo == one project. Certain existing repos (notably golang.org/x) are noncompliant, and would need to be split out to conform. This and other ramifications were considered to be acceptable costs for the benefit of the simplifying abstraction.
>
> If that's so (and I don't see it clearly resolved on this issue's comment history), then I suggest the changes to the code be done and shown to be successful before this proposal is accepted. Then the argument that the definition of project is reasonable will include a list of current projects and successfully converted projects. Ideally with a tool to check them and a site (maybe godoc.org) to track them.

You would propose to block the proposal until golang.org/x/* is restructured into independent repos?

I think it's a fine exercise, but I don't see how it could fail, and I think it'd be a shame to block the proposal until it's finished. Especially given the proposal is opt-in, and seeks only to define a schema, i.e. is agnostic to more concrete details.

(Or, perhaps I overlook something?)
